java.io.Serializable
public class AlloyLookAndFeel
extends javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLookAndFeel

Implements the Alloy Look&Feel.

AlloyLookAndFeel

public AlloyLookAndFeel()
Creates a new instance of AlloyLookAndFeel.

AlloyLookAndFeel

public AlloyLookAndFeel(AlloyTheme theme)
Creates a new instance of AlloyLookAndFeel that uses the specified AlloyTheme as its theme.

Parameters:
theme - the theme to be used. If null, the default theme will be used.
Method Detail

setTheme

public void setTheme(AlloyTheme newTheme,
                     boolean updateAllUIs)
Sets the theme for the AlloyLookAndFeel.

Parameters:
newTheme - the new theme
updateAllUIs - if true all available component trees will be updated automatically

updateAllUIs

public static void updateAllUIs()
Convenience method to update all components that are part of the component hierarchy.

getID

public java.lang.String getID()
Return a string that identifies this look and feel. The returned string is always "Alloy".

Specified by:
getID in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Return a short string that identifies this look and feel and that can be used for labeling a menu item. The returned string is always "Alloy".

Specified by:
getName in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns a description of the Alloy Look&Feel including the version number.

Specified by:
getDescription in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

isNativeLookAndFeel

public boolean isNativeLookAndFeel()
Always returns false, because the Alloy Look&Feel is not a native look and feel.

Specified by:
isNativeLookAndFeel in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

isSupportedLookAndFeel

public boolean isSupportedLookAndFeel()
Always returns true, because the Alloy Look&Feel is supported on all platforms.

Specified by:
isSupportedLookAndFeel in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

getSupportsWindowDecorations

public boolean getSupportsWindowDecorations()
The Alloy Look&Feel currently does not provide support for window decorations in a JRootPane. This may change in future versions.

Overrides:
getSupportsWindowDecorations in class javax.swing.LookAndFeel

getDefaults

public javax.swing.UIDefaults getDefaults()
This method is called once by UIManager.setLookAndFeel to create the look and feel specific defaults table.

Overrides:
getDefaults in class javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLookAndFeel

getControlTextFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getControlTextFont()
Returns the font that is used on standard controls, such as buttons, labels etc. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

getSystemTextFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getSystemTextFont()
Returns the font that is used on controls like tool tips, trees, tables, lists etc. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

getUserTextFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getUserTextFont()
Returns the font that is used on editable controls, such as text fields, text areas, text panes etc. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

getMenuTextFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getMenuTextFont()
Returns the font that is used on menu controls. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

getWindowTitleFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getWindowTitleFont()
Returns the font that is used on window title panes. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

getSubTextFont

public static javax.swing.plaf.FontUIResource getSubTextFont()
Returns the font that is used for smaller text, like menu accelerators. Returns null if no font theme has been set.

setProperty

public static void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
Sets a propery with the specified key/value pair. If a property with the same key exists, it will be overridden. Currently supported properties are:
  • alloy.licenseCode This is the license code that is required to use the Alloy Look&Feel.
  • alloy.theme The theme that is used by default. This property has only an effect if it is set before an instance of AlloyLookAndFeel is created.
  • alloy.isWebStartSandbox
